content.description: Fun route with good holds, just like the other three at Tectonic.  Pull through a big flake followed by a crack to a ledge.  Climb your way to some massive KY plates after that to the easily clippable anchors.
content.location: Located on the wall perpendicular and right of Fifth Bolt Faith

content.description: The furthest left sport route on this section of wall, move left to a nice arete and balance your way to the chains on delicate feet.
Another classic...a tricky start leads to pumpy plate pulling pleasure...Yeah!
Go up to a ledge, pull the roof and continue up on a wide dirty crack to a tree. Be creative to protect on this section. Once you reach the tree traverse left to the chains on Tall Cool One.
content.protection: Mid-sized cams. Large nut for wide crack section. Alpine draws for extensions on the ledge. Rappel from bolted anchor on Tall Cool One.
content.location: First line from right to left sharing the wall with Tall Cool One.

content.description: Wide vertical crack/flake with lots of laybacking, stemming, and chimney moves.
content.location: Begins above a large belay ledge left of the 4 sport routes that are left of the cave that is left of the main Tectonic routes. (Approximately 150 yards left of Gettin' Lucky in Kentucky".

climbs.name: Gettin' Lucky in Kentucky
climbs.fa: Hancock, Carandang, Truesdale, T. and Truesdale, I., 2004

content.description: This climb is a classic "must-do" for the area...technical/pumpy climbing featuring pockets, jugs, and sidepulls with a steep finish.  Enjoy!
content.location: Farthest route to the left on the Tectonic Wall.

climbs.name: Frozen Bananas
climbs.fa: Bryce Noonan, Bryan Battles, Cameron Link, Luke Rhoades, 2014

content.description: Figure out how to reach the flake and follow it up and right to a roof.
content.location: Find the cave left of Gettin' Lucky in Kentucky. This route climbs out the flake on the right side of the cave. Find some jams and stems then locate the anchors around the corner on the right.

climbs.name: Fifth Bolt Faith
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Mark Ryan, Karla Canandang - 2005

content.protection: 6 bolts and a nice two-bolt Muir Valley anchor with some rings.
content.location: this route follows the bolt line directly to the right of Plate Tectonics.

content.description: Overhanging slot requiring some slithering, squeezing, and squealing. Bring big gear.
content.location: Left of Serpentine and right of the wide ledge where LIDAR is located.

content.description: Interesting and hard to read moves off the ground with undercut feet to the right make for some bouldery moves to the rest at the ledge above. Pick your way around the damp and sandy holds and ledge before busting into the crux face moves and to a left-trending rail/dihedral. Cop a couple of great, smooth hand jams and enjoy easier terrain for two more bolts to the top.
content.location: Left of the main cluster of routes at Tectonics on the next panel of climbable rock. There are four routes on this panel. This route is the right-most on the wall. A metal tag is in place at the bottom.

content.description:
Easy start leads to ultra technical / ridiculously large moves. There's a lot of chalk going out left at the third bolt going to four. It looks as though the route boomerangs around left then up right back to the bolt. Or, go direct with giant moves or tiny intermediates. Either way, try to have fun!

Note: The medallion at the base of the route says "Boom-Slang 5.11c.) It feels more like 5.12c!
content.protection: Brand new wave bolts to anchors

content.description: Finesse your way past the first bolt on rounded holds to reach longer moves on big holds, then take on the dyno or use sharp crimps and crank to the jug. Run to the anchors
content.location: Located between Cottonmouth and Dime-a-dozen, Muir valley tag at the start

content.description:
Stem across or wiggle up the off-width to a ledge. Protected by three bolts. Then work up a wide chimney to the ring anchors.

Also possible to head up a "Tall Cool One", traverse 8 feet left to the top anchors, and set-up a TR.
content.protection:
Mixed route. Bring gear to #4 BD (there is an off-width section).

3 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: In between "Fifth Bolt Faith" and "Tall Cool One."
